title: Suspect in Rochester mass shooting was arrested at airport
content:
ROCHESTER – A second suspect in a mass shooting that left three dead here in August was arrested last week at Buffalo Niagara International Airport as he was attempting to leave the state, Rochester police reported Tuesday.
Jalen Jamel Everett, 20, of Rochester, is expected to be arraigned Wednesday on a first-degree murder charge in connection with the Aug. 19 drive-by shooting in front of the Boys & Girls Club on Genesee Street here that killed three young men and wounded four other persons. Johnny Blackshell Jr., 21, of Chili, already has been charged with first-degree murder in the case.
Everett was arrested Sept. 29 at the Buffalo airport, Rochester Police Chief Michael Ciminelli said, and has been in custody since then. He was charged with fourth-degree criminal possession of stolen property relating to a laptop computer. He was arrested in connection with the murders on Tuesday. .
